page.title: 20HIGH HURSTWOOD'S FUTURE? (2)
page.content: very existence. The Church has had a reprieve with the timely arrival of a non-stipendiary Priest-in-charge, but its future is uncertain. An Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty is a delightful place in which to live but the limitation on new building can mean an ageing population and the loss of the very way of life which attracted people here in the first place. Farming has been the lifeblood of the area for centuries, but farmers also are anxious about the future. The authors of this project are from the Women's Institute which still flourishes but finds it hard to attract younger women and draws many of its members from outside the area.
